edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface
Class CuratorReducer

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer<Text,HadoopRecord,Text,HadoopRecord>
      edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.CuratorReducer

public class CuratorReducer
extends Reducer<Text,HadoopRecord,Text,HadoopRecord>

A Reducer that serves as a wrapper for the document annotation tool. It handles creating a locally-running Curator, launching and calling the annotation tool, and so on. After running the annotation tool, new annotation will be written to HDFS.

Method Detail

reduce

public void reduce(Text inKey,
                   HadoopRecord inValue,
                   Reducer.Context context)
            throws IOException,
                   InterruptedException,
                   org.apache.thrift.TException
Asks the Curator to get an annotation (the type of which is specified in the context's configuration) for the document record in inValue.

Parameters:
inKey - The document's hash
inValue - The record for the document, which includes both the original text file and the known annotations.
context - The job context
Throws:
IOException
InterruptedException
org.apache.thrift.TException

toolIsRunning

public boolean toolIsRunning(AnnotationMode toolToCheck)
                      throws EnumConstantNotPresentException
Checks the log files in your Curator directory (`~/curator/dist/logs`) to see if the indicated tool has finished launching.

Parameters:
toolToCheck - The annotation tool in question (more accurately, the type of annotation provided by the tool)
Returns:
TRUE if the log file indicates the tool is running. FALSE if the log file *should* indicate the tool is running successfully, but it does not. Note that if the annotation tool, through an aggravating design decision, does *not* indicate explicitly when it's ready to go, we make a best guess based on when the log file was last modified.
Throws:
EnumConstantNotPresentException

curatorIsRunning

public boolean curatorIsRunning()
Checks the log files in your Curator directory (`~/curator/dist/logs`) to see if the indicated tool has finished launching.

Returns:
TRUE if the log file indicates the Curator is running.

startTool

public void startTool(AnnotationMode toolToLaunch)
               throws IOException
Runs the shell script required to launch the indicated annotation tool. If this script is not found in your Curator directory (i.e., at `~/curator/dist/scripts/launch_annotator_on_this_node.sh`), we'll simply create it.

Parameters:
toolToLaunch - The annotation tool to launch (more accurately, the type of annotation provided by the tool to be launched)
Throws:
IOException

startCurator

public void startCurator(AnnotationMode runningTool)
                  throws IOException
Runs the shell script required to launch the indicated annotation tool. If this script is not found in your Curator directory (i.e., at `~/curator/dist/scripts/launch_curator_on_this_node.sh`), we'll simply create it.

Parameters:
runningTool - The annotation tool that is already running on this Hadoop node
Throws:
IOException
